required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Vaginoscopy Compared to Traditional Hysteroscopy for Hysteroscopy Morcellation in Outpatient Clinic. A Randomized Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Pain Perception During Vaginoscopy Compared to Traditional Hysteroscopy for Hysteroscopy Morcellation in Outpatient Clinic: A Randomized Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal (CHUM)

clinical_study.source: Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal (CHUM)

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a randomized controlled trial take place in a fertility outpatient clinic in an academic hospital. Women between 18 and 52 years old requiring polypectomy or myomectomy by hysteroscopy morcellation for abnormal uterine bleeding or for fertility issue are included. The aim is to evaluate pain perception between vaginal and traditional hysteroscopy for hysteroscopic morcellation. The investigator's hypothesis is that pain perception is lower using vaginoscopy compared to traditional hysteroscopy.

detailed_description.textblock:
78 participants will be randomised in two groups:
1. traditional hysteroscopy: under intravenous sedation, hysteroscopic morcellation is perform after speculum insertion, vaginal cleansing, and paracervical anesthesia with xylocain 1%.
2. Vaginal hysteroscopy: under intravenous sedation, hysteroscopic morcellation is perform after vaginal cleansing using vaginal distension with saline solution
In addition to pain perception, other outcomes includes: complication rates, time to continue fertility treatment, time to pregnancy

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in pain perception between vaginoscopy group and traditional hysteroscopy group
primary_outcome.description: 10 point visual analog pain scale: 0 for no pain to 10 for unbearable pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in length of time of procedure between vaginoscopy group and traditional hysteroscopy group
secondary_outcome.description: length of time in minutes between start and end of procedure including morcellation

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in proportion of vasovagal syncope between vaginoscopy group and traditional hysteroscopy group
secondary_outcome.description: Presence of jerky abnormal movements or a slow weak pulse rate associated to at least one symptoms: nausea, pale skin, blurred vision, warm feeling or cold sweat.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in proportion of uterine perforation between vaginoscopy group and traditional hysteroscopy group
secondary_outcome.description: presence of one or more signs during intervention: extension of the instrument goes beyong the limitation of the uterus, loss of resistance, sudden loss of vision, direct visualisation of the perforation

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in length of time to continue fertility treatment between vaginoscopy group and traditional hysteroscopy group
secondary_outcome.description: length of time in months to continue fertility treatment after procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in length of time to pregnancy between vaginoscopy group and traditional hysteroscopy group
secondary_outcome.description: length of time in months to be pregnant after procedure

arm_group.description: morcellation hysteroscopy with intravenous sedation and paracervical bloc
morcellation hysteroscopy with only intravenous sedation

intervention.description: vaginal distension with hysteroscope for hysteroscopy morcellation (without speculum or tenaculum forceps)
speculum, paracervical block before hysteroscopy morcellation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- polyp or fibroid previously diagnosed by hysteroscopy
- polyp less than 2 cm
- submucosal fibroid (type 0 or 1 according to the 2011 FIGO uterine fibroid classification) less than 2 cm
- if more than 1 fibroid: total fibroid have to be less or equal 4 cm
Exclusion Criteria:
- cervical stenosis
- polyp or fibroid more than 2 cm
- pregnancy
- blood dyscrasia

facility.name: CHUM - Clinique Médecine et biologie de la reproduction
